Publication Title: RAD-TGTs: high-throughput measurement of cellular mechanotype via rupture and delivery of DNA tension probes
Publication Authors: Matthew R Pawlak, Adam T Smiley, Maria Paz Ramirez, Marcus D Kelly, Ghaidan A Shamsan, Sarah M Anderson, Branden A Smeester, David A Largaespada, David J Odde, Wendy R Gordon
Publication Abstract: Mechanical forces drive critical cellular processes that are reflected in mechanical phenotypes, or mechanotypes, of cells and their microenvironment. Publication Title: Multiscale models of integrins and cellular adhesions
Publication Authors: Tamara C Bidone, David J Odde
Publication Abstract: Computational models of integrin-based adhesion complexes have revealed important insights into the mechanisms by which cells establish connections with their external environment. However, how changes in conformation and function of individual adhesion proteins regulate the dynamics of whole adhesion complexes remains largely elusive. Publication Title: Optimal cell traction forces in a generalized motor-clutch model
Publication Authors: Roberto Alonso-Matilla, Paolo P Provenzano, David J Odde
Publication Abstract: Cells exert forces on mechanically compliant environments to sense stiffness, migrate, and remodel tissue. Cells can sense environmental stiffness via myosin-generated pulling forces acting on F-actin, which is in turn mechanically coupled to the environment via adhesive proteins, akin to a clutch in a drivetrain.
